title: League provisionals placements for Season 6
body: I'm currently sitting in silver V, I had no trouble getting out of bronze and I'm looking forward to climbing more. If let's say season 5 resets at November 1st, I would not have much time to climb, so let's say I make it to silver 3 following the reset. Will I be placed back in bronze if I get a 5-5 provisionals in Season 6? If so which division of bronze?

replies.body:
Honestly don't be worried about falling into bronze, if you earned silver you can do it again.

As for the reset, last years was really rather harsh, it's likely the same will happen this year but this isn't as bad a thing as you think, it's more determined by your first few provisionals.

Not to mention the Pre season can also effect your ranking for next season. (new season start is around January from memory.)
I was plat 4 and went 8-2 on my placement matches, found my self in silver 1... not sure whats the logic in that...

As long as you remain in Silver V or manage to climb by the end of the season you should be able to avoid starting your provisionals at bronze level MMR. Keep in mind it's not just about how many provisional games you win or lose, the order in which you win or lose also has an impact.
What seriously? I've heard many cases in which people who ended the season with silver 5/4/3 ends up in. Bronze 5. Even with positive provisionals like 7-3

Thing is though, it will generally adjust the MMR you ended the season with around Silver V MMR, so you wont actually start your provisionals any lower than Silver V if you ended the season above it (and similarly wont start provisionals any higher than Silver V if you ended the season below it). Like I said, it still depends on how you do in your provisionals.

I was bronze 1 last season and went 10-0 on placements and ended up at bronze 3 this season. i stayed away from ranked last season so i didnt really climb, but come on. 10-0 and still bronze 3? that's kinda crazy in my opinion

Do remember that promo series are much more easier to win the second time round as well. So if you do deserve the higher elo, climbing shouldn't be difficult at all. For all the people who dropped more than 5 ranks you probably bad mmr.
